I put an xml file to a server.
The mediaType is text/xml.
The server reads =
it into memory using an xml parser.

There is a well formed error in the xm=
l.

HTTP has succeeded, the transport has taken place.
The resource has not=
 been created (not written to disk hence
no available resource for a client=
 to GET).

What should the response be, at the HTTP layer?
200, transfer su=
ccessful
or
201 resource created.

I *think* that parsing the file is appli=
cation layer,
so I could write a bad XML file to disk
ready for a GET.

Bit=
 gray?
Or clear as a bell?

Advice please
